localize.text: 1. You are in the role of the manager of Lobotomy Corporation.
2. Your job is to safely manage Abnormalities and produce an energy source known as ‘Enkephalin’.
3. You will have a daily quota that must be met each day in order to progress onto the next day.
The Agents are your subordinates, who follow your orders to work with Abnormalities. They are your hands, so to speak.
The ‘HP’ of your Agents will increase as their Fortitude increases. An Agent’s Fortitude will increase any time they perform Instinct Work.
HP (Health Points): The physical strength and vitality of an Agent; if this drops to zero, they will die.
The ‘SP’ of your Agents will increase as their Prudence increases. An Agent’s Prudence will increase any time they perform Insight Work.
SP (Sanity Points): The mental strength and stability of an Agent; if this drops to zero, they will panic.
The ‘Work Speed’ and ‘Success Rate’ of your Agents will increase as their Temperance increases. An Agent’s Temperance will increase any time they perform Attachment Work.
Work Speed: The rate at which an Agent completes the Work Process with an Abnormality.
Success Rate: The ability of an Agent to succeed in their work, produce more Positive Enkephalin, and take less damage during the Work Process.
The ‘Attack Speed’ and ‘Movement Speed’ of your Agents will increase as their Justice increases. An Agent’s Justice will increase any time they perform Repression Work.
Attack Speed: The rate at which an Agent attacks with their equipped E.G.O.
Movement Speed: The speed at which an Agent moves from one place to another.
Agents begin at Level 1 and can be promoted up to Level 5. The higher an Agent’s level, the greater skill and Virtues they have.
Each Virtue also has a Level from 1 to 5.
When stats rise to a certain threshold from working, the level of their Virtue will increase at the end of the day.
The level of a Virtue corresponds to the level of the related Work the Agent can do.
The Agent’s level is based on the sum of the levels of their Virtues; an Agent’s level will increase alongside their Virtues.

There are four (4) types of Work that can be performed with the Abnormalities. For each individual Abnormality, you will need to find the most appropriate type of Work, and steadily proceed to produce energy.

A work to satiate physiological needs; it requires physical contact. As it involves touching the Abnormality frequently, Agents will need to display a high level of bravery and Fortitude to perform high level Instinct Work. Employees who conduct this work will benefit from increased HP.

A work to improve the Abnormality’s living conditions. As it involves realizing what environment each Abnormality favors the most and making appropriate adjustments to ensure optimal conditions, meticulous observation is required; Agents need to show a high level of intellect and Prudence to perform high level Insight Work. Employees who conduct this work will benefit from increased SP.

A work to satiate social needs. All Abnormalities carry desires and a will, and as such social needs are included. As this work involves acting as a playmate or companion, great care is required as only limited interaction is allowed; to avoid crossing the line, Agents need to show a high level of caution and Temperance to perform high level Attachment Work. Employees who conduct this work will benefit from increased Work Speed and Success Rates.

A work to restrain existence. While the other works focus on handling desires, this one stifles them. As this work involves regulating various emotions and desires, careful and objective decision making as well as strong rationality is needed to control the pace of the work; Agents need to show a high level of Justice—the ability to make definite judgements—to perform high level Repression work. Employees who conduct this work will benefit from increased Attack and Movement Speed.
Abnormalities are entities that emerge from the depths of humanity’s deep and ancient dreams: the Collective Unconscious. We can extract Enkephalin from them with careful and appropriate management.
Please be aware that no Abnormality can ever truly be considered safe.
Please refer to the Risk Level titles below when managing Abnormalities.
With little to no aggression, ZAYIN Abnormalities will cause the least harm to your Agents. Their damage tends to be minuscule, and they may have a positive effect on the employees.
These Abnormalities can inflict varying degrees of injury to your employees. However, as long as your employees follow the proper managerial guidelines, they will not cause much damage.

Abnormalities of this class can easily kill a number of employees. You will have to pay twice as much attention as you do for a ZAYIN or TETH. If the situation goes wrong, several employees could be lost in bloodshed. There’s no need to be concerned though; with your excellent management, they will be in control.
These are high risk and carry devastating force. Most will be hostile toward employees, and the death toll could reach into the dozens.

The most dangerous. You should devote as much concentration and attention as possible to this Risk Level. You’ll be thankful if the Abnormality is suppressed without ravaging entire departments. (Please do not take our warning as an exaggeration.)
The Abnormalities have four types of attacks:
This type relates to physical damage. When RED damage is dealt, the HP of the receiver will be reduced.
While RED represents physical damage, WHITE represents psychological damage. When WHITE damage is dealt, the SP of the employee on the receiving end will be reduced.
A complex of physical and psychological damages. When BLACK damage is dealt, both the HP and SP of the employee on the receiving end will be reduced.

Death itself. PALE shaves away the soul. Even the toughest body and wisest mind will not matter; all are equal in the face of death. When PALE damage is dealt, HP will be reduced in proportion to the maximum HP of the employee on the receiving end.
E.G.O (Extermination of Geometrical Organ) refers to the equipment produced to confront Abnormalities.
We have E.G.O Weapons as a means of offense, and E.G.O Suits as defensive equipment.
E.G.O can be extracted from Abnormalities that have been managed up to a certain Observation Level.
As E.G.O is forged using “archetypes” extracted from Abnormalities, they can inflict or resist RWBP damage types, which cannot be reproduced normally.

Each E.G.O has a grade from ZAYIN to ALEPH. One thing you should know is that the higher the E.G.O’s grade, the more effective it becomes. E.G.O with a higher grade will have higher attack and defense power against certain attack types.
E.G.O with a high grade will benefit from increased damage and defense against Abnormalities of a lower risk level.
Conversely, E.G.O with a low grade will deal less and take more damage against an Abnormality with a high risk level.
Here you will be able to see the highest level of Ordeal that may appear during the current workday.
Ordeals will manifest as the workday progresses.
LOB are points you will acquire as you complete each day.
LOB is used for hiring and fortifying Agents.
This button will open the E.G.O List.
This button is for hiring new Agents.
Each department will display the missions that can be attempted for the day.
If you clear a department’s mission, you will be able to conduct specialized research projects.
Here you will see the Abnormalities currently placed within the department.
Abnormalities whose Encyclopedias do not yet have Basic Information unlocked will be displayed as a question mark (?).
This button will allow you to view the description and role that pertain to the department and its team.
This button will allow you to view the completed research projects of the department.
Research will be very helpful for Abnormality management.
You can hire a new Agent by clicking the HIRE button.
To hire a default random employee, simply click the HIRE button again.
Default employees only require 1 LOB to be hired.
You can adjust the level of each Virtue by clicking on the arrows.
Additional LOB will be charged for raising a Virtue level.
Higher Virtue levels will require more LOB.
You can spend an additional 1 LOB to customize the appearance of a new hire.
Agents who are already a part of your facility can be fortified using LOB by clicking this button.
Deployed and undeployed Agents can be clicked on to view more information.
Fortifying an already hired Agent uses the same menu as adjusting the Virtue levels of a new hire.
You can open the E.G.O List by simply clicking on the corresponding button.
E.G.O Weapons are equipment that enhance one's offensive capabilities.
The RWBP type of the E.G.O
The range of possible damage values the E.G.O can inflict
The speed at which attacks are delivered
The distance necessary to land a blow with the E.G.O
E.G.O Suits are equipment that enhance one's defensive capabilities.
The E.G.O’s defensive multiplier against each attack type
If the multiplier is lower than 1.0, then the E.G.O will be effective against the corresponding attack type
Likewise, if it is higher than 1.0, then the E.G.O will be vulnerable against the corresponding attack type
You can view E.G.O of a specific grade by clicking on the grade’s corresponding tab.
This will display the detailed descriptions and any special abilities of the E.G.O.
Some E.G.O may require certain Virtue levels or general Agent level.
Agents have a chance to acquire this form of E.G.O upon completion of a Work Process, or occasionally, via the fulfilment of special criteria. It will affect the various stats of an Agent.
Click on an E.G.O slot. The E.G.O cannot be equipped if the Agent does not meet the requirements.
Here you will be able to see the E.G.O the Agent has currently equipped.
Click and hold on an Agent.
Drag and drop the Agent onto the department in which you wish to deploy them.
To complete the day, you must gather the specified amount of PE-Boxes. This gauge will fill each time PE-Boxes are produced after the completion of a Work Process with an Abnormality.

This gauge predicts the next upcoming Qliphoth Meltdown; it represents the passage of time through the workday’s various Qliphoth Meltdowns and Ordeals. Every time an Agent enters a Containment Unit to begin work, this gauge will increase by 1 tick. If the gauge is completely filled, a Qliphoth Meltdown will occur, or an Ordeal will manifest.
This is your list of missions that can be attempted during the workday.
These buttons can be used to pause and control the flow of time in the facility.
This will display the history of work that has been done through the course of the day, along with casualties and panics.
Whenever this gauge fills, the HP and SP of the employees in the Main Room of the department will be restored. However, this gauge will not function while an Abnormality is present in the room.
You can use the Right Mouse Button to click and drag the camera’s position.
The WASD Keys can be used to move the camera towards the corresponding positions.
The camera can be zoomed in and out with the Mouse Wheel. (The F and G Keys can also be used.)
Agents can still receive orders while time is on pause, and will follow them once it resumes.
You can see the relevant information of an Agent by hovering the mouse cursor over them. If you click on the Agent, the UI that displays the info will be affixed until something else is clicked on.
Click on an Agent you wish to move. If you desire to move a group of Agents, click and drag to select them.
With the selected Agent(s), right-click the location for them to move to.
This button will recall Agents who are not in the Main Room of the department back to it. (This function needs to be unlocked via the corresponding Control Team research.)
The maximum number of E-Boxes that can be produced per Work with the Abnormality.
Different work result ranges according to PE-Box count.
Attack type and damage range during work.
Department Agent List (To have employees work in departments other than their own, the corresponding Control Team research will need to be completed.)
The amount of time it will take the Agent to complete the Work Process.
Step 1: Left Click on the Containment Unit
Step 1: Click and drag to select a group
Step 2: Right Click on the unit
Step 4: Choose from your selected group
The PE-Boxes produced in the previous work.
As the work progresses, the Abnormality will produce a PE-Box (Positive Enkephalin Box) or a NE-Box (Negative Enkephalin Box). Only PE-Boxes can be refined and processed into energy.
Your goal as the manager is to find out how to safely produce as many PE-Boxes as possible from the Abnormalities.
The manner in which we do so is quite simple:
After receiving an order from the manager, an Agent will proceed to the designated Containment Unit.
Each time an Agent enters a Containment Unit, the Qliphoth Meltdown Gauge will increase by 1 tick. If you need to know more about this gauge, please refer to the section about Qliphoth Meltdowns.
Please make sure to keep in mind that some Abnormalities may immediately attack when an Agent enters the Containment Unit if the managerial guidelines are not complied with.
When an employee comes across an Abnormality, they may be struck with fear, causing some amount of mental damage.
Abnormalities of higher risk levels will deal more mental damage to Agents of lower levels.
This mental damage will also occur during encounters with Abnormalities that have left their Containment Unit.
Each Abnormality will have different success rates for different Work Types. Therefore, depending on the chosen type, the outcome of the Work Process may change.
The Success Rate is determined by the Virtue level corresponding to the type of work being done, along with the employee’s Success Rate stat (Temperance).
The Success Rate determines whether a PE-Box or NE-Box is produced.
Success and Failure during the Work Process
The Abnormality will produce a PE-Box.
The Abnormality will produce a NE-Box.
Each time a NE-Box is produced, the Abnormality will attack the employee.
If an Agent’s HP or SP hits zero during the Work Process, they will die or panic.
If such an instance occurs, the Work Process will end prematurely and the remaining E-Boxes will be produced as NE-Boxes.
The E-Box Gauge will fill corresponding to the produced PE-Boxes.
The final number of PE-Boxes will determine the result status of the work. There are 3 ranges of result: Bad, Normal, and Good.
Produced PE-Boxes will then be stored as unique PE-Boxes for the Abnormality. Unique PE-Boxes can be used to unlock more of the Abnormality Encyclopedia and produce E.G.O.
The Qliphoth Counter of Abnormalities may decrease if they are managed incorrectly, typically due to a Bad work result or violated managerial guideline.
The Qliphoth Counter can be found on the UI of the Containment Unit.
When the Qliphoth Counter reaches 0, the Abnormality will escape its Containment Unit or use its special abilities.
Please be careful as to ensure no Qliphoth Counter reaches 0.
The Success Rate of work with WAW and ALEPH Abnormalities will decrease as the count of works completed with them increases.
Containment Units with Qliphoth Overloads will display the current amount of reduction in Success Rate. This reduction will also be reflected in the Order UI.
Containment Units with Qliphoth Overloads will return to normal when a Qliphoth Meltdown occurs. When this Meltdown occurs, all reduced success rates will be restored to their original values.
Every time a Qliphoth Meltdown occurs, this level will rise.
Each time an Agent enters a Containment Unit, the Qliphoth Meltdown Gauge will increase by 1 tick.
When the gauge is filled, a Qliphoth Meltdown will occur throughout the facility.
As the Meltdown Level rises, so too does the number of affected Containment Units.
An alarm timer will be shown on all Containment Units undergoing a Qliphoth Meltdown. This timer will gradually decrease.
When this timer hits 0, the Qliphoth Counter of the Abnormality within the Containment Unit will become 0, and the unique PE-Box count will decrease.
The Qliphoth Meltdown dissipates as soon as an Agent enters the Containment Unit.
The Qliphoth Meltdown gauge will not rise when Containment Units under Meltdown are entered.
However, the reduced success rate from Qliphoth Overloads will still be reflected in the work.
At certain levels of Qliphoth Meltdowns, an Ordeal will manifest instead of Containment Unit Meltdowns occurring.

‘Ordeals’ are a form of Abnormality that is unrefined. Ordeals come in four risk levels, corresponding to the times of day: Dawn, Noon, Dusk, and Midnight. As the level of Qliphoth Meltdowns increases, higher levels of Ordeals will manifest.

Ordeals will hinder the management of Abnormalities in a variety of ways. However, as Ordeals are also a form of Abnormality, they can be suppressed just the same by ordering your Agents. To learn more about suppressing Ordeals and Abnormalities, please see the section ‘Suppressing Abnormalities’.
You can open the Encyclopedia window by clicking on the Containment Unit nameplate of the Abnormality.
This section will display the story of the Abnormality. The story will be updated with each Observation Level.
This is the Basic Information for working with the Abnormality.
The Success Rates of each Work Type
The Qliphoth Counter, and RWBP resistances if the Abnormality escapes.
The E.G.O that can be produced or obtained at the current Observation Level.
You can unlock more of the Encyclopedia by spending an Abnormality’s unique PE-Boxes.
When all the information in a category is unlocked, the Observation Level will increase.
An Agent has a low chance of acquiring an E.G.O Gift when completing the Work Process with an Abnormality after reaching a certain Observation Level. E.G.O Gifts affect an Agent’s stats.
Reaching the requisite Observation Level of an Abnormality will allow the production of the Abnormality’s corresponding E.G.O. Most E.G.O production requires unique PE-Boxes.
Unlike most Abnormalities, Tools are Abnormalities that emphasize a concept of “usage” instead of “management”.
1. Single Use: Agents utilize this Tool with an immediate effect.
2. Equippable: Agents must equip this Tool to gain its effect.
3. Channeled Use: Agents must continually use this Tool to gain its effect.
Every 5 days, starting from your 4th (Day 4, Day 9, etc.), a new Tool Abnormality will be extracted.
1. Click the Containment Unit of the Tool Abnormality to open the Order UI, then send an Agent to use it.
2. The Agent will equip or use the Tool Abnormality.
3. The Agent can be ordered to stop usage of a channeled use Tool or return an equippable Tool by clicking again on the Containment Unit.
The Encyclopedia of a Tool Abnormality will automatically update in accordance to the number of uses or total time used.
If the Qliphoth Counter of an Escaping Abnormality reaches 0, the Abnormality will leave its Containment Unit.
The Qliphoth Counter can decrease not just due to a Bad work result, but also from violation of management methods.
Escaping Abnormalities need to be suppressed quickly. To learn more about suppressing Abnormalities, please see the section ‘Suppressing Abnormalities’.
Any employee whose HP drops to 0 due to damage from a RED, BLACK, or PALE attack will die.
If an Agent dies, their equipped E.G.O will be destroyed.
1. Any employee whose SP drops to 0 due to damage from a WHITE or BLACK attack will panic.
2. Panicking Agents can be brought back to sanity when they have recovered their SP fully from healing attacks with WHITE or BLACK E.G.O.
If the workday ends while an Agent is still in panic, they will be disposed of.
If an Abnormality escapes, or employees die or panic, an alarm will sound depending on the severity of the situation.
An Abnormality has breached and poses a minor threat to the facility and its employees.
It’s not too late to improve the situation. A competent manager can handle this much. Of course, it will cost several employees.
It would be a miracle if you recover from this situation. Most employees have died, and it will be nigh impossible to suppress the breaching Abnormalities.
The defensive multipliers against attacks done to it.
Using E.G.O that the Abnormality is weak to (defensive multipliers of 1.0 or more) will allow suppression to be easier.
Your Agents’ HP, SP, and E.G.O can be checked here.
1. Click on the escaping Abnormality or its Containment Unit.
2. Select the Agents you want to send to suppress it. Once a certain Control Team research is complete, other departments can easily aid in the suppression.
3. You can cancel the suppression order of any Agent by clicking on them if they are already suppressing.
1. Select the Agents who you wish to suppress by clicking (and dragging).
2. With your selected Agent(s), right-click on the escaping Abnormality.
Managerial Bullets will be unlocked by completing research in the Middle Layer’s departments.
The quantity of bullets available will be influenced by the number of ticks needed to fill the Qliphoth Meltdown Gauge.
Once all bullets are expended, they will not be reloaded until a Qliphoth Meltdown has occurred. When the Qliphoth Meltdown occurs, the bullet count will be fully reloaded.
1. Click on the Bullet UI or press the corresponding Number Key (1-8) to load the bullet.
2. Once the bullet is loaded, the mouse cursor will change to the bullet’s corresponding crosshair.
3. Aim the cursor over the target and click the mouse to fire the bullet.
4. To unload the bullet, click on the Bullet UI or press the Number Key again.
The results card will show what missions have been cleared.
Increases in Virtues and levels of each Agent will be shown.
Every time you end the Day, you will receive LOB in accordance to how well you did.
The greater the number of Remaining Agents, the higher the rank and more LOB will be acquired.
If the Day ends while an Abnormality is escaping, there will be a penalty upon the amount of LOB earned.
After the Day is finished, you can choose whether to move on to the next Day or retry the current Day.
If you choose to retry the Day, all lost Agents and E.G.O will be recovered. However, any progress toward Observations and E.G.O made that Day will be gone.
The Memory Repository will be imprinted every 5 Days. (Day 1, Day 6, Day 11, and so on.)

Unlike retrying a single Day, rewinding to the Memory Repository will maintain all unlocked Observations and gained E.G.O. However, department expansion and extracted Abnormalities will regress to the state of the imprinted Day.
You can elect to rewind to the Memory Repository in the ESC-Button Menu.
Each time you advance to the next Day, you will need to choose what Abnormality to extract.
Ensure you carefully read the Extraction Quote of each Abnormality before choosing.
Every time you advance to the next Day, you will need to choose what department to expand for the newly extracted Abnormality’s Containment Unit.
Each time you expand a department, its Expansion Level will increase.
When the Expansion Levels of all current departments reach the maximum, new departments will become available for opening.
In cases where two departments can be opened at the same time, either department can be opened and expanded at your choosing without the need to maximize the Expansion Level of the other.
The higher an Abnormality’s risk level, the more difficult it will be to manage.
This button will display the department’s special functions.
If every Agent of one department is in another department of which they do not belong, a countdown will start.
For a given department, if all Agents are absent and the countdown hits zero, every Clerk in that department will panic.
Clerk Benefits are applied accordingly to the current number of surviving Clerks in the departments. The benefit applied will vary for each department.
The effectiveness of the benefit will increase as the department expands. Higher levels will have better effects.
Level 3: 100%~80% of the department’s Clerks are alive; Expansion Level 5
Level 2: 80%~50% of the department’s Clerks are alive; Expansion Level 3+
Level 1: 50%~30% of the department’s Clerks are alive; Expansion Level 1+
As Clerks die or panic during the workday, the percentage of Clerks alive will decrease, and as a result, the Clerk Benefit Level may decrease.
If the number of Clerks alive in the department reaches zero, the Clerk Benefit will be shut off for the department.
Agents gain benefits for the number of days they have been in their department.
Continued Service Benefits will vary for each department. Agents who have gained such a benefit are gifted with a special title and a unique signifying armband.
However, if an Agent that has gained a Continued Service Benefit is transferred to another department, the effects, armband, and title will all be removed.
Additionally, an even more unique armband and benefits will be granted to a single Agent in the department who has worked the longest among their peers for more than 7 days.
If all Agents from a department die, the Success Rate of all Containment Units in the department will decrease by a significant degree.
If all Agents die, every Clerk in that department will immediately commit suicide and the Clerk Benefit for the department will be lost.
3. The behaviour a panicking Agent will take is determined by the Agent’s highest Virtue.
4. The higher the level of an Agent, the more difficult it will be to bring them back to sanity. Furthermore, the damage they can cause to the facility and their coworkers will tend to be heavier.
5. Please be aware that if you finish the Day with any Agents in panic, they will be immediately disposed of.
